Salary:
   
   
  Giatec Scientific Inc. (Giatec) is looking for a Quality Engineer (QE) to be part of the Product Development / Supply Chain Management team. As a Quality Engineer, you will be responsible for ensuring all electrical or mechanical components, parts, or Hardware (HW) assemblies meet or exceed quality standards and requirement.
   In this role, you will also become part of a cross functional team collaborating with designers, engineers, suppliers, and manufacturers to deliver highest quality products to our customers. 
  The work location for this role is primarily onsite (i.e. at Giatec's office/lab in Ottawa, ON).
   RESPONSIBILITIES:
  
    Read and interpret drawings, sketches, bill of materials, manufacturing instructions and product specifications to determine requirements.
    Perform receiving, in-process, and final inspections on material, components, assemblies and finished electronics products.
    Manage satisfactory resolution of non-conforming products through established procedures. 
   Conduct regular on-site vendor assessment of production process, auditing, identifying, and resolving quality issues and training Contract Manufactures.
    Contribute to designing assembly, test and inspection procedures in collaboration with product engineers and suppliers/manufacturers.
    Analyse data, detect anomalies, determine root cause and implement corrective actions.
    Contribute to the development of new products and validation procedures representing QE perspective and requirements.
  
   REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
  
    3 to 5 years of experience inspecting/working with electro-mechanical assemblies or auditing manufacturers.
    Experience with manufacturing PCBA/electronics assemblies and finished product box building to IPC 610 class II.
    Exposure to quality management standards (ex: ISO9001, IATF 16949, AS9000) and good understanding of concepts involved in them. 
   Strong computer based analytical skills (Computer programming skills using scripting languages is a plus)
    Attention to detail and excellent problem-solving skills.
    Able to work independently and with minimum supervision.
    Excellent communication skills 
   Must be able to lift 15Kg.
    Must have a valid driver's licence and be able to travel up to 25% of the time.
    Possess Electronics Technology or Engineering degree.
  
   ABOUT GIATEC:
   Giatec is on a mission to transform the Concrete industry. We have products that enable Concrete Producers to save time and money, and most critically, lower their GHG emissions. We have customers throughout North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific. We are a diverse group of people committed to continuous learning and building a company with Purpose and Integrity. We have been growing and profitable for over 10 years.
   We fundamentally believe that attracting and keeping smart and talented people is a key to our success. We are looking for creative and passionate people to join our rapidly expanding team.
   TO APPLY:
   Do you have some of these skills but maybe not all? We still encourage you to apply as we would love to review your unique application and learn more about you! Please send a brief cover letter and resume to us indicating why you believe you would be a good fit for this role.
   At Giatec, we know that diversity, inclusion, and a sense of belongingness are critical to our success. We believe that employees with diverse backgrounds and experiences strengthen our workplace culture, boost our creativity, and help us to revolutionize the concrete industry.
   Giatec is dedicated to creating a barrier-free environment starting with the hiring process. If you require any special accommodation or support during the recruitment process, please indicate in your email to us.

LifeLabs is currently looking for a Medical Lab Assistant to join our team in Ottawa, ON.

 Job Description: 
 Senior Biologist 
 Parsons is seeking Senior Biologist to compliment the Planning and Ecological Services Group in Ottawa and/or the Greater Toronto Area. Parson’s Planning and Ecological Services Group works both in support of other internal groups (primarily land development/transportation/streets and bridges, and stormwater management) and also as an independent unit completing ecological assessments and monitoring duties directly for various clients. 
 
 Duties will include field investigations and inventories, impact assessment studies and mitigation plans, during and post-construction monitoring of environmental project components, and preparation of technical reports and memos. The successful candidate will be required to work in the field on projects primarily based in Eastern or Southern Ontario with flexible office work arrangements. 
 
 Responsibilities: 
 
  Collects and records field data, performs data entry and management, analysis, and reporting. 
  Performs a variety of field and office tasks requiring the application of standard scientific principles and fundamental theories. 
 
 
  Performs background research of available resources for potential environmental constraints. 
  Undertakes and participates in biological field investigations and data collection (e.g., breeding bird and amphibian surveys, bat acoustic surveys, vegetation inventories and tree surveys, wildlife and species at risk surveys, Ecological Land Classification assessment, wetland evaluations, and fisheries assessments) following established protocols. 
  Preparation of maps, including vegetation community delineation, and management of field data using ArcGIS. 
  Provide mentoring to intermediate and junior staff members. 
 
 
 The successful candidate will have a combination of the following education and experience: 
 
 
  7+ years of related work experience in environmental consulting and/or municipal, provincial, or federal environmental planning. 
  Post-secondary education in Ecology, Biology, Forestry and/or other Biological Science. 
  Current or past certification as an ISA Certified Arborist or Registered Professional Forester is considered an asset. 
  Experience in the collection, analysis, and reporting of field data following established protocols. 
  Knowledge of aquatic and terrestrial environments, vegetation, and wildlife of Ontario and relevant legislation (e.g., Fisheries Act, Endangered Species Act, 2007, Species at Risk Act, Migratory Birds Convention Act, Fish and Wildlife Conservation Act ). 
  Experience in the accurate identification of Ontario flora and fauna (trees, shrubs, wildflowers, grasses, birds, reptiles amphibians, mammals, and/or insects). 
  Experience on MTO projects and RAQS Certification (Nature Science) considered an asset or experience to obtain RAQS certification. 
  Strong knowledge of environmental permitting process at the municipal, provincial and federal level. 
  Strong knowledge of Species at Risk found in Ontario, including identification, habitat, and life-history. 
  Experience in completing Environmental Impact Assessment following municipal, provincial or federal policies or acts. 
  Maintaining and organizing accurate and detailed fieldnotes as well as photo documentation records. 
  Proficiency in the use of ArcGIS Software. 
  Excellent written and oral communications skills particularly technical report writing. French language written and oral communication skills considered an asset. 
  Ability to work independently with minimal supervision as well as within a team environment to meet tight deadlines.

JOB DESCRIPTION RI-23-053
Posting Period: October 23, 2023 to November 6, 2023
POSITION: AI Research Analyst
TERM: Full-time (FTE 1.0) – 1 year contract with possibility of renewal
SALARY: $60,000 - $70,000 CAD per annum, plus benefits
REPORTS TO: Principal Investigator, Christine Armour
Children’s Hospital of Eastern Ontario Research Institute (“CHEO RI”) is the research arm of the Children’s Hospital of Eastern Ontario – Ottawa Children’s Treatment Centre (“CHEO”) and an affiliated institute of the University of Ottawa. CHEO is a beloved institution and workplace that is widely recognized for being an anchor in our community. CHEO RI works to create new knowledge and evidence to support CHEO in its provision of world-class care for our children. Our mission at CHEORI is to connect exceptional talent and technology in pursuit of life-changing research for every child, youth and family in our community and beyond.
CHEO RI has an immediate requirement for an AI Research Analyst.
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated AI Research Analyst to join Dr. Christine Armour’s research team, in support of the CHEO Precision Child and Youth Mental Health Initiative. The AI Research Analyst will contribute to a machine learning (ML) and data science project (via CHEO RI and BORN Ontario) with the goal of developing predictive algorithms for population-based datasets. This is an exciting opportunity to improve mental wellness for the next generation through cutting-edge mental health research leading to precision healthcare for children, youth and families.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Under the general supervision of the Principal Investigator, the AI Research Analyst will:

 Design, implement, and iteratively improve an appropriate data science and machine learning framework to support the goals of the projects.
 Contribute to the development and deployment of appropriate data science and ML models to derive outcomes and obtain value from the data.
 Train, evaluate, and retrain systems and models as needed.
 Perform statistical analysis to report on experimental results and model testing.
 Demonstrate specialized skills and standardized data science techniques (e.g., regression, segmentation, deep learning, feature importance, model explainability, experiment logging, model drift monitoring, etc.).
 Work with a team to identify and acquire new data sources and provide input into data transformation rules required to prepare data for advanced analytics use cases.
 Prepare output of analyses for review including graphs, tables, figures, and interpretation of experimental results.
 Maintain documentation, code, analysis, and results so work can be understood and repeated in accordance with coding best practices.
 Contribute to insightful presentations, communicating technical material, and growing others’ technical understanding.
 Support innovation by proactively identifying and championing projects that solve complex problems through the application of data science and ML techniques.

QUALIFICATIONS, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES

 Master’s degree in Applied Epidemiology/Biostatistics /Computer Science/Data Science, or equivalent, with a concentration in data science and machine learning programming and techniques (Required)
 Supporting degree or education in biology/biochemistry, biostatistics, bioinformatics, computational biology, computer science, applied mathematics, machine learning, perinatal research or related scientific fields with 2+ years’ working experience in computational biology, bioinformatics and/or machine learning in pharma, biotech or academic setting (Preferred)
 Understanding of data structures, data modeling and software architecture (Required)
 Mastery of one or more analytical programming languages such as R, Python, SAS, Stata, and the ability to learn and adapt to new programming languages as needed. (Required)
 Demonstrated experience with data visualization techniques and tools for effective presentation of results (Required)
 Ability to define and develop data analysis strategies under minimal supervision with high degree of scientific competence and organizational attention to detail (Preferred)
 Knowledge of quantitative techniques (normalization, standardization, applied statistics) for clinical results (Preferred)
 Experience working with large-scale healthcare data sets (Preferred)
 Experience with Transformer-based ML architectures (Preferred)
 Experience working with images, image processing, and computer vision (Preferred)
 Outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills.
 Concise communication of scientific concepts, data analysis, clinical interpretation, and reporting.
 Excellent communication skills, verbal and written.
 High-energy self-starter with experience and passion for large scale data analysis. You enjoy working in fast-paced environments and love making an impact.
 Strong ability to prioritize and communicate to technical and non-technical audiences alike.

WORKING CONDITIONS

 Flexibility to work in a hybrid work model that would include both remote work and occasional on-site work.

OTHER REQUIREMENTS

 Eligible to work in Canada;
 Compliance with CHEO RI’s Universal COVID-19 Vaccination Policy; and
 Police Record Check.

Please send a complete CV and cover letter to Lia Blake: lblake@bornontario.ca.

DESCRIPTION DE POSTE RI-23-053
Période d’affichage — du 23 octobre au 6 novembre 2023
POSTE : Analyste de recherche en IA
DURÉE : Poste à temps plein (ETP 1,0) — contrat d’un (1) an avec possibilité de renouvellement
SALAIRE : 60 000 $ – 70 000 $ CAN par année, plus les avantages sociaux
RELÈVE DE : Chercheuse principale, Christine Armour
L’Institut de recherche du Centre hospitalier pour enfants de l’est de l’Ontario (« IR de CHEO ») est l’organisme de recherche du Centre de traitement pour enfants du Centre hospitalier pour enfants de l’est de l’Ontario situé à Ottawa (« CHEO »), et un institut affilié de l’Université d’Ottawa. CHEO est une institution et un milieu de travail que nous chérissons et qui est largement reconnu pour être une source de soutien dans notre collectivité. L’IR de CHEO travaille pour créer de nouvelles connaissances et de nouvelles preuves pour soutenir CHEO dans sa prestation de soins de classe mondiale à nos enfants. Notre mission, à l’Institut de recherche de CHEO, est de relier des technologies et des talents exceptionnels dans la poursuite de recherches qui ont une incidence sur la vie de chaque enfant, jeune et famille de notre collectivité et ailleurs.
L’IR de CHEO a immédiatement besoin d’un ou d’une analyste de recherche en IA.
Nous sommes à la recherche d’un analyste de recherche en IA hautement qualifié et motivé qui se joindra à l’équipe de recherche de la Dre Christine Armour pour appuyer l’Initiative de santé mentale de précision pour les enfants et les jeunes de CHEO. L’analyste de recherche en IA contribuera à un projet d’apprentissage automatique (ML) et de science des données (par l’entremise de l’IR de CHEO et de BORN Ontario) dans le but d’élaborer des algorithmes prédictifs pour les ensembles de données démographiques. Il s’agit d’une occasion intéressante d’améliorer le mieux-être mental de la prochaine génération grâce à des recherches de pointe en santé mentale, qui mènent à des soins de santé de précision pour les enfants, les adolescents et leurs familles.
RESPONSABILITÉS
Sous la supervision générale de la chercheuse principale, l’analyste de recherche en IA devra :

 Concevoir, mettre en œuvre et améliorer de façon itérative un cadre approprié de science des données et d’apprentissage automatique pour soutenir les objectifs des projets.
 Contribuer à l’élaboration et au déploiement de modèles pertinents de science des données et d’apprentissage automatique pour en obtenir des résultats et tirer pleinement parti des données.
 Former, évaluer et recycler les systèmes et les modèles, au besoin.
 Effectuer une analyse statistique pour rendre compte des résultats des expériences et des essais de modèles.
 Démontrer des compétences spécialisées et des techniques de science des données normalisées (par exemple, régression, segmentation, apprentissage profond, documentation de l’importance des caractéristiques et de l’explicabilité des modèles, surveillance de la dérive des modèles, etc.).
 Travailler avec une équipe pour identifier et acquérir de nouvelles sources de données, et fournir des conseils en ce qui a trait aux règles de transformation des données nécessaires pour préparer les données pour les cas d’utilisation analytique avancée.
 Préparer les résultats des analyses aux fins d’examen, y compris les graphiques, les tableaux, les chiffres et l’interprétation des résultats des expériences.
 Tenir à jour la documentation, le code, l’analyse et les résultats afin que le travail puisse être compris et répété conformément aux pratiques exemplaires de codage.
 Contribuer à l’élaboration de présentations éclairées, à la communication de matériel technique et à la compréhension technique des autres.
 Soutenir l’innovation en identifiant de manière proactive et en défendant des projets qui résolvent des problèmes complexes par l’application de la science des données et des techniques d’apprentissage automatique.

QUALIFICATIONS, COMPÉTENCES ET CAPACITÉS

 Maîtrise en épidémiologie appliquée, en biostatistique, en informatique, en science des données, ou l’équivalent, avec une concentration en sciences des données et en programmation et techniques d’apprentissage automatique (Obligatoire)
 Diplôme ou formation complémentaire en biologie ou en biochimie, en biostatistique, en bio-informatique, en biologie computationnelle, en informatique, en mathématiques appliquées, en apprentissage automatique, en recherche périnatale ou dans un domaine scientifique connexe, ainsi qu’une expérience professionnelle de plus de deux (2) ans en biologie computationnelle, en bio-informatique et (ou) en apprentissage automatique dans le secteur pharmaceutique, biotechnologique ou universitaire (Préférable)
 Compréhension des structures de données, de la modélisation des données et de l’architecture logicielle (Obligatoire)
 Maîtrise d’un ou plusieurs langages de programmation analytique tels que R, Python, SAS, Stata, et capacité à apprendre et à s’adapter à de nouveaux langages de programmation, au besoin (Obligatoire)
 Expérience démontrée des techniques et des outils de visualisation des données pour une présentation efficace des résultats (Obligatoire)
 Capacité de définir et d’élaborer des stratégies d’analyse de données sous une supervision minimale et de démontrer un haut niveau de compétence scientifique, d’organisation et d’attention aux détails (Préférable)
 Connaissance des techniques quantitatives (normalisation, standardisation, statistiques appliquées) pour les résultats cliniques (Préférable)
 Expérience de travail en utilisant de grands ensembles de données de soins de santé (Préférable)
 Expérience avec les architectures transformatrices d’apprentissage automatique (Préférable)
 Expérience de travail sur les images, le traitement d’images et la vision informatique (Préférable)
 Excellentes capacités d’analyse et de résolution de problèmes.
 Communication concise des concepts scientifiques, de l’analyse des données, de l’interprétation clinique et des rapports.
 Excellentes aptitudes de communication, à l’oral et à l’écrit.
 Esprit d’initiative, dynamisme, passion pour son travail, et expérience de l’analyse de données à grande échelle. Capacité de travailler harmonieusement dans un environnement à rythme rapide et ambition d’apporter une contribution.
 Forte capacité d’établir les priorités et de communiquer efficacement avec des publics techniques et non techniques.

CONDITIONS DE TRAVAIL

 Souplesse de travailler dans un modèle de travail hybride qui pourrait à la fois inclure le travail à distance et, à l’occasion, le travail sur place.

AUTRES EXIGENCES

 Être autorisé à travailler au Canada;
 Respecter la politique universelle de vaccination contre la COVID-19 de l’IR du CHEO;
